H0.text: who was canadian prime minister in 1993. Kim Campbell

H1.text: who was canadian prime minister in 1993. Jean Chrétien

H2.text: who was canadian prime minister in 1993. John Turner

H3.text: who was canadian prime minister in 1993. Brian Mulroney

A4.text: Campbell became the new prime minister in June 1993 after Mulroney resigned in the wake of declining popularity.

A5.text: Mulroney entered 1993 facing a statutory federal election. By then, his popularity had markedly declined, and polls suggested that the Tories would be heavily defeated if he led them into that year's election.

A6.text: On November 4, 1993, Chrétien became prime minister.
